mentions.context: As SpeexDSP is an online algorithm, we apply it twice to each utterance to ensure convergence.
Since SpeexDSP relies on half-overlapping rectangular STFT windows, we use a window of length 512 and hopsize 256.
We initialize H(f ) and G(f ) by applying SpeexDSP and WPE on d(n, f ), respectively, with the same hyperparameters as above.
We initialize the echo-only variant for estimating H 0 (f ) by applying SpeexDSP on d(n, f ) with the same hyperparameters as above.
1) Initialization of the linear filters: For echo cancellation, we compute H 0 (f ) by applying SpeexDSP on each channel of d(n, f ).
For dereverberation, we compute G 0 (f ) by performing 3 iterations of WPE on the signal e(t) output by SpeexDSP.

To create the reverberant near-end speech s(t), we convolved anechoic nearend speech u(t) with near-end RIRs a s (τ ) simulated to match the echo recording properties using the Roomsimove toolbox [45] [41,Sec. 7.1].
